arm_group.description: 30 people are recruited in order to the inclusion criteria for the study. Placebo controlled.
30 people are recruited in order to the inclusion criteria for the study. Experimental group.

brief_summary.textblock:
The main objective of this study is to evaluate the effectiveness of different manual
      techniques included traditionally on respiratory physical therapy

clinical_study.brief_title: Results of Manual Therapy on Pulmonary Parameters

detailed_description.textblock:
Randomized controlled trial. Participants are classified in two groups and they are assessed
      using pulmonary functions parameters and thoracic and spinal movements.

      There are two interventions: placebo and a manual technique. Participants will be assessed
      again at the end of the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  subjects with respiratory conditions

          -  Must be able to do spirometry

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  subjects with acute processes in their pathologies

intervention.description:
A manual technique is employed in the intervention group based on passive movement and stretching of the respiratory system.
The manual technique includes:
stretching of diaphragm. Mobilization. Potentiation of the respiratory muscles.

facility.name: Faculty of health Sciences. University of Granada

clinical_study.official_title: Manual Therapy Results on Pulmonary Function and Musculoskeletal Movement

oversight_info.authority: Spain: Comité Ético de Investigación Clínica

primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline to postintervention in spirometry parameters (Vital capacity, Forced expiratory volume in the first second (FEV1), Tidal volume)using a spirometer as recommended by the American Thoracic Society.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Changes from baseline to postintervention in thoracic movement, measured by tape measure in 3 thoracic levels.
Functional status questionnaire used before and after intervention to measure functionality scores change.
Changes on cardiorespiratory capacity measured by 6MWT (6 minutes walking test)at baseline and post intervention.
Changes from baseline to postintervention in spinal movement, measured by Range of motion with goniometer.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
